header.title: Charge your vehicle safely and avoid potential risks
header.description: An electric vehicle can represent one of the highest energy demands within a home, business, or shared facility. For this reason, charging must be carried out using equipment specifically designed for this purpose and with a proper electrical installation.

risks.title: Situations when dedicated equipment is not used

overload.title: Excessive strain on the electrical installation
overload.description: Electrical installations are not always designed for prolonged high-power charging, whether in homes, offices, or parking facilities.

protections.title: Electrical protections not designed for continuous use
protections.description: Standard circuit breakers and residual-current devices may not be suitable for this type of continuous consumption.

outlets.title: Use of non-dedicated outlets
outlets.description: Standard power outlets are not designed to supply an electric vehicle for several consecutive hours.

inefficiency.title: Energy inefficiency
inefficiency.description: In unprepared installations, energy losses may occur due to heating of conductors, connections, or adaptations, reducing charging efficiency and placing additional stress on the electrical system.

batteryWear.title: Constant 100% charging
batteryWear.description: Always charging to full capacity can accelerate battery wear.

dedicatedEquipment.title: Equipment specifically designed for EV charging
dedicatedEquipment.description: This is not an adapted outlet, but a system dedicated exclusively to this purpose.

powerRegulation.title: Power regulation
powerRegulation.description: Charging power adjusts to the capacity of the installation, preventing overloads in both residential and commercial environments.

smartScheduling.title: Smart scheduling
smartScheduling.description: Enables charging during off-peak hours and optimizes energy usage.

mobileControl.title: Mobile control
mobileControl.description: Real-time monitoring and management of charging through the app.

batteryCare.title: Battery care
batteryCare.description: Charging limits can be configured to extend the vehicle’s battery lifespan.

professionalInstallation.title: Professional installation
professionalInstallation.description: Installation is carried out by authorized technicians, with protections and configuration adapted to the equipment’s use and the environment where it is installed.

efficiency.title: Greater efficiency, better use of energy
efficiency.description: A proper installation and dedicated equipment allow for more efficient energy transfer, with fewer losses caused by overheating or improper connections. This results in more stable, safer charging and better use of the energy consumed.

ChargingSafetySection.closing:
Charging an electric vehicle is not the same as plugging in a household appliance.

 It is a specialized electrical installation, both in homes and businesses, and must be treated as such.

compatibility.title: Is it compatible with my electric vehicle?
compatibility.answer: Yes. Our chargers work with the vast majority of electric and plug-in hybrid vehicles sold and imported in Uruguay.

compatibility.title: Which brands are supported?
compatibility.answer: They are compatible with the main electric vehicle brands present in Uruguay, including Asian, European, and American manufacturers. BYD, Hyundai, Kia, Chevrolet, Renault, Nissan, BMW, Audi, Mercedes-Benz, Peugeot, Citroën, MG, Geely, OMODA, Haval, Chery, JAC, Dongfeng/Nammi, DFSK, Seres, Forthing, Jaecoo, Mini, Volvo, Jaguar, among others.

compatibility.title: Does it also work with plug-in hybrids?
compatibility.answer: Yes. It works with plug-in hybrid vehicles. If the car can be charged by connecting it to the power grid, it is compatible with our chargers.

compatibility.title: How do I know which charger I need?
compatibility.answer: We advise you based on your vehicle, your electrical installation, and your usage habits to recommend the best option.

installation.title: Can it be installed at my home?
installation.answer: Yes. We assess your electrical installation and configure the charger so it operates safely.

installation.title: Can it be used in buildings or companies?
installation.answer: Yes. It is ideal for homes, apartment buildings, parking facilities, and companies with fleets. We offer power options ranging from 7.4 to 22 kW.

installation.title: Do I need major electrical upgrades at home?
installation.answer: Not always. In many cases, only a dedicated line and proper electrical protections are required.

installation.title: Can I install it myself?
installation.answer: It is not recommended. Rayforce performs installation and certification with technicians authorized by UTE, ensuring safety and regulatory compliance.

usage.title: How long does it take to charge the car?
usage.answer: It depends on the vehicle, but it is usually much faster and safer than using a standard household outlet.

usage.title: Can I control it from my phone?
usage.answer: Yes. You can start, pause, schedule charging sessions, and view consumption from the app.

usage.title: Can I charge during lower-cost hours?
usage.answer: Yes. You can schedule charging to take advantage of lower-cost hours according to your UTE plan.

usage.title: Can it be used outdoors?
usage.answer: Yes. It is designed to operate outdoors.

usage.title: What happens if there is a power outage?
usage.answer: When power is restored, the charger resumes normal operation.

safety.title: Is it safe to leave the car charging overnight?
safety.answer: Yes. It is designed for prolonged charging sessions with proper electrical protections.

safety.title: Does it help prevent fires or short circuits?
safety.answer: Yes. Using standard outlets can cause overheating. Our chargers are installed with protections and power regulation, significantly reducing risks.

safety.title: Will my home's power go out while the car is charging?
safety.answer: No. Charging power can be regulated to keep enough capacity available for normal household use.

safety.title: Can I help extend my car battery’s lifespan?
safety.answer: Yes. You can set charging limits, such as stopping at 80%, to help extend battery life.

costs.title: Is it better to always use public charging stations?
costs.answer: Public charging is useful for trips or occasional situations, but it is not always the most economical option. As of January 1, 2026, public charging rates from UTE increased by approximately 50%, and the general trend is to encourage home charging.

support.title: Does it include warranty and local support?
support.answer: Yes. All equipment includes warranty coverage and local technical support.

support.title: Does it comply with Uruguayan regulations?
support.answer: We work with equipment that complies with current regulations and the requirements of UTE and URSEA.

RegulatorySection.title: Regulatory compliance and energy benefits
RegulatorySection.paragraph1: Our chargers are approved and aligned with current Uruguayan regulations, complying with the requirements established by UTE and URSEA.
RegulatorySection.paragraph2: This ensures a safe, reliable installation fully compatible with the national power grid. It also allows access to UTE benefits and programs, such as the Redondo Plan, subject to current conditions.
